title.narrative: Technology for Preparedness in Southeast Asia

description.narrative: The Global Disaster Preparedness Center (GDPC) and American Red Cross are partnering with Red Cross national societies in Southeast Asia to pilot using mobile technologies, including interactive applications (apps) and SMS messaging, to enhance disaster preparedness in the region. By introducing interactive hazard preparedness apps in up to five countries in the region, the GDPC and American Red Cross will help partners increase public access to preparedness information and improve decision-making towards safety and resilience. The GDPC will provide Red Cross partners access to a web-based platform where they can adapt and contextualize the American Red Cross hurricane/flood app for release in their own country. The GDPC will also offer technical guidance throughout the app development process, sharing resources for translation and marketing for the apps, among others. This 18-month project is funded by the United States Agency for International Development’s Office of Foreign Disaster Assistance (OFDA).
